title.narrative: Post-Hurricane Harvey Disaster Legal Services for Lone Star Legal Aid's Beaumont Office

description.narrative: The grant will pay a portion of the one-year salary and fringe benefits of a Disaster Legal Services paralegal for LSLA’s Beaumont office, and she/he will join a Disaster Legal Services attorney funded by the Texas Bar Foundation. Hurricane Harvey survivors will encounter immediate and long-term legal problems, such as relocation and transitional housing; evictions and lease terminations; foreclosures; repair scams; insurance claims and appeals; property rights, title-clearing, probate, and tax problems; lost/destroyed documents; appealing FEMA decisions; income maintenance; access to health care; unemployment benefits; family law issues; and wills and estates. Over the one-year project period, the paralegal, working under attorney supervision, will conduct disaster-based community outreach and education in Beaumont, Port Arthur, and Orange, and he/she will provide free legal services to disaster survivors to help them gain stability, recover and rebuild. Working under attorney supervision, the Paralegal will conduct intake, interview applicants and clients, and give legal advice; perform case research and investigation; enter data, write letters and handle applicant communications; open and close cases promptly complying with LSLA policies; prepares legal instruments and reports requested by the Managing Attorney of the Beaumont office and the paralegal's partner attorney; and perform other related duties as assigned.
